_source.Subject: question about xh035
_source.Description: Request on gate leakage in DCD
_source.Support: No gate leakage data (pmos, nmos, nmos_ln) in XH035 but provided characterized data thanks to Suba.

_source.Subject: question about xh035
_source.Description: Request on gate leakage in DCD
_source.Support: No gate leakage data (pmos, nmos, nmos_ln) in XH035 but provided characterized data thanks to Suba.

_source.Subject: compatibility of XH035 analog lib in XA035
_source.Support:
We don't offer an analog library for XA035 and don't claim compatibility of the XH035 analog library, not even of particular analog cells, with XA035.
The XH035 analog cells are mainly characterised for the temperature range up to 85°C, some of them up to 125°C (please refer to information in the XH035 analog cell databook/ datasheets). We have not characterised the XH035 analog cells to the operating temperature range of XA035 (-40 °C to 175 °C), thus according specification data is not
existing.

_source.Subject: how to perform LVS on photodiode in OECB gds
_source.Support:
dlwbn relates to the TUIMP which is part of the CPOD device construction. There is no model or device for these diodes – the only support we have are the layouts in the OECA evaluation chip.

For LVS, could try the following suggestion by the runset developer, though I have not tested it myself.
Place the DIODEF layer around the structures. Then place the recognized devices in a schematic view. Suggest to use virtual connect of all substrate contacts during the LVS run to avoid the multiple stamp connection error. Some structures of the layout are defined only as parasitic diodes. That means this structures are ignored during the LVS comparison. In the extracted netlist are all structures available.

_source.Subject: 5V SPRAM
_source.Description: Customer is interested and looking for 5V SPRAM IP in XH035.
_source.Support: Currently, XH035 SPRAM both SP and DP supports only 3.3V and 2.2V ranges. There is no plan to support 5V range.

_source.Subject: Migrate design (Schematic and Layout) from iPDK v3 to v6
_source.Description: Customer is looking for a way on how to migrate their design from v3 to v6 with relatively low effort.
_source.Support:
We don't provide it as a service and there is no ready-to-use design migration tools. The earlierst version we had previously dated back to 2010 however, it's not
compatible with XENV system. Therefore, customer will need to perform manual migration followed by design re-validation.

_source.Subject: Question regarding RF amplifiers
_source.Description: Customer inquire if there is ready made RF amplifiers models in CMOS 350nm. If there is any, what is the amplification level. This is research project whereby customer wanted to combine CMOS SPAD with a amplifier on chip level
_source.Support: There is no RF poweramplifier design available in 0.35um technologies. So far, our previous customer design their own low frequency RF in X*035 (1<Ghz). X-Fab did not support this at the moment.

_source.Subject: Low Noise Operational Amplifier
_source.Description: Inquire if there is any low noise opam IP at least 1Mhz of bandwidth that can drive 100pF load at power supply over +-5V in 0.18um and 0.35um
_source.Support: In 0.18um and 0.35um, most of of the op-amp is rated for 1.8V or 3.3V supply. There are few only for 5V and above which are not suitable for 100pF loads. Suggested customer to XC06 A_CELLS_5V that have two op-amps which might suitable for customer requirement.

_source.Subject: About thin-film resistor
_source.Description: Customer is looking for TaN, SiCR or thin film resistor in XH035.
_source.Support:
Have thus far, we do only have an experience with TF resistors, but this is limited only to concept study with no actual development and
data characterization data available. There is no dedicated module to implement this device at the moment. To proceed so, COT is required

_source.Subject: Smallpad for XA035
_source.Description: Request to use 6x6um probepads  in XA035 as what they did previously in XC06.
_source.Support:
Unfortunately, smallpad option is not available in XA035.  Different technology use different metal stack and passivation, thus patterning
result can be different as well. The risk of PAD not open properly is still there for 5x5um/6x6um/7x7um, unless there is a re-development 
carried out to tune the process in order to achieve small pad size
